name: Jeffrey Popyack
content: Jeffrey L. Popyack Professional Affiliations/Activities Current: Emeritus Professor of Computer Science Department of Computer Science, Drexel University Member, Executive Council, Upsilon Pi Epsilon, 1991-2009, 2010-17, 2018- International President: 1995-6, 2000-2, 2006-8, 2014-6, 2021-2 columnist, ACM Inroads. columns Principal Investigator, Jumpstarting Philadelphia CS for All Researcher-Practitioner Partnership (w/Jamie Payton, Tammy Pirmmann) (2020-) Co-chair, CS4Philly Advisory Committee (w/Jamie Payton) (2019-) Co-chair, Philadelphia STEM Ecosystem Computer Science Workgroup (w/Jamie Payton) (2019-) Member, Philadelphia STEM Ecosystem Steering Committee (2019-) Old Favorites: Faculty Advisor, Upsilon Pi Epsilon Student Chapter (1989-2022) REThink CS @ Drexel (2013-6), (2017-2020) (Research Experiences for Teachers Site for Machine Learning to Enhance Human-Centered Computing) Visiting Professor, Department of Computer Science, Duke University (Spring 2017) Phase II Pilot Site/Instructor for AP Computer Science Principles (2013-6) Robot Springboard @ Drexel (2013-19), an exciting outreach program for which I was pleased and proud to be a mentor Faculty Advisor, DUCSTeach (2012-7), Women in Computing Society (2006-8), MCS Society (1999-2012) Academic Director, Drexel University Computing Academy, 2009-12 (formerly Pennsylvania Governor's School for Information, Society and Technology, 2001-8) Project DUPLEX (2000-2005) Associate Head for Undergraduate Affairs, Department of Computer Science, 2002-2012 Coach, Scholastic Computer Programming Team, 1984-2011 Course Information Highlights ARCHIVES: Designing the Personal Computer of the Year 2000 (from UPE Spring 2000 newsletter) ARCHIVES: My Eyewitness Account of DEEP BLUE's Historic Defeat of Garry Kasparov, Feb. 10, 1996 Post-It Pandemonium Read about our Post-It Pandemonium educational activities. Inside Scoop on Commencement Activities Armed with a digital camera, your intrepid photographer has recorded these images from Drexel's Commencement Exercises... (Note: from 2009-14, pictures taken by Julie Fisher and/or me appear on the CS Dept. Facebook page.)
